page_content:
![](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/_assets/3137b1a864c689786cac76b3def62dd1/Assets/img/default-banner.jpg)

# Correcting Information on a Driver's Licence

If an error appears on your driver's licence or if you wish to change some information, you must notify the SAAQ.

To make corrections or changes to your driver's licence, you must go in person to one of our [service outlets](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/find-service-outlet), except for a change of address.

## Procedure

### If you are a Canadian citizen

Go in person to one of our [service outlets](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/find-service-outlet) and present the following documents:

- your driver's licence
- an original birth certificate issued by the [Directeur de l'état civil⁠ ⁠](http://www.etatcivil.gouv.qc.ca/en/default.html) (if you were born in Québec) or by the official issuing authority in the province or territory where you were born, **or** your Canadian Citizenship Certificate issued by [Citizenship and Immigration Canada⁠ ⁠](http://www.cic.gc.ca/english/index.asp)
- a name change certificate or change of sex designation certificate, if applicable

### If you are not a Canadian citizen

1. [Call us](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/reach-us) to make an appointment. An employee will analyze your request and tell you what documents to bring.
2. Bring the following documents to the appointment:
- your driver's licence
- the original of the documents requested by the employee

page_content:
### Applying to change the sex designation on your driver's licence

To have the sex designation changed on your driver's licence, you must first complete the form corresponding to your situation on the website of the [Directeur de l'état civil⁠ ⁠](https://www.etatcivil.gouv.qc.ca/en/change-sexe.html) (DEC - registrar of civil status). Then, after receiving the change of sex designation certificate issued by the DEC, you can make an appointment at one of our service centres.

If you have been living in Québec for less than a year, call us.

The [applicable fees](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees-renew-replace-exchange) are the same as those charged to have a driver's licence replaced.

**The only change that can be made over the telephone is...**

A [change of address](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/reach-us/change-address).

For any other requests, you need to go in person to one of our [service outlets](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/find-service-outlet) and present the documents required.

Last update: April 29, 2024

- ## Contact us

Québec area: 418-643-7620

Montréal area: 514-873-7620

Elsewhere: 1-800-361-7620 (Québec, Canada, United States)

- ## Find us

- [Find a Service Outlet](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/find-service-outlet)
- ## Costs

page_content:
Montréal area: 514-873-7620

Elsewhere: 1-800-361-7620 (Québec, Canada, United States)

- ## Find us

- [Find a Service Outlet](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/find-service-outlet)
- ## Costs

[Fees](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees-renew-replace-exchange) apply, unless :
- the error was made by the SAAQ
- a condition must be added to the driver's licence following a medical assessment or a declaration regarding your [state of health](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/state-health-licence)
- ## Documents to provide

**You are a Canadian citizen**

- Driver's licence
- Birth certificate **or** Canadian Citizenship Certificate
- Name or sex change certificate, if applicable

**You are not a Canadian citizen**
- Driver's licence
- Original of the documents requested by the information clerk
- ## Online services

- ## See also

- [Checking the Validity of a Driver's Licence](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/checking-validity-licence)
- [Recognition of Foreign Driver's Licences](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/canadian-foreign-drivers-licence)
- [Obtaining a New Licence Upon Returning to Québec](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/reacquiring-reinstating-drivers-licence/stay-outside-quebec)
- ## Other websites

## Safety first, on the road and online

We are committed to protecting your personal information and privacy. That's why, when we collect data, we follow a [Policy on Privacy](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/policies/privacy) that is responsible and transparent. By continuing to browse without modifying your preferences, you accept the use of cookies.
